thread.title: These 12 online shopping sources will be donating proceeds to Planned Parenthood
thread.title_full: These 12 online shopping sources will be donating proceeds to Planned Parenthood

author: Olivia Harvey
title: These 12 online shopping sources will be donating proceeds to Planned Parenthood
text:
These 12 online shopping sources will be donating proceeds to Planned Parenthood Weâ€™ve reached a period in history where getting involved in current happenings is crucial. After witnessing and being a part of the masses who came together for the Womenâ€™s March on Washington, as well as so many other marches around the world, we felt the need to continue doing anything we can to help the cause.
As of right now, Planned Parenthood is in danger, due to the new administration. Therefore, affordable access to womenâ€™s health services and education is also in danger, and those services are things women cannot afford to lose . Weâ€™ve compiled a list of online shops and fundraising campaigns that are donating some or all of their profits to Planned Parenthood. By shopping on these sites, not only are you getting some really cool feminist merchandise, but your money is going to help your sisters who rely so much on Planned Parenthood.
1. Omaze â€” Lena Dunhamâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Hang Up The Glovesâ€ shirts ($27) If youâ€™re not familiar with Omaze, itâ€™s a pretty Omaze-ing website (sorry). Omaze parters with those who wish to raise money for an organization that may not be able to do so on its own. Writer and actress, Lena Dunham, teamed up with Omaze to raise money for the Planned Parenthood Education Fund by selling these very cool feminist t-shirts.
Subtle rainbow to keep up the theme Donâ€™t hang up your gloves! The fight is on and fiercer than ever ğŸ›  Iâ€™m in Sacramento right now urging our California leaders to continue to support our reproductive rights. Join us and be your tough-as-nails self in this tee I designed using my own fightin' hands. Get yours at omaze.com/lena and support Planned Parenthood. Please do it and Iâ€™ll love you forever- oh, and so will millions of women and their families! #IStandWithPP #WeWontGoBack 
A photo posted by Lena Dunham (@lenadunham) on Jan 17, 2017 at 10:01am PST 
The funds collected from Dunhamâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Hang Up The Glovesâ€ shirt campaign will go specifically to the California Planned Parenthood Education Fund, â€œa statewide organization that works to ensure access to preventive and reproductive health care,â€ Omaze states in the description. This campaign has already reached its goal of selling 1000 shirts, and shirts will ship two weeks after the campaign ends on February 10th.
2. Female Collective â€” â€œGirls Just Wanna Have Fun-ding For PPâ€ shirts ($26) Female Collective, headed by Candace Reels, is an awesome source of feminist gear we can wear to our next march. Reels collaborated with Jessica Bennet, author of Feminist Fight Club , to create one of the OG â€œPussy Grabs Backâ€ t-shirts, as well as several other funny feminist logo tees, all of which we want in our closets.
Girls Just Wanna Have Fun-Ding For Planned Parenthood being shipped out today! 20% of the proceeds going to @plannedparenthood. Link in bio = ) 
A photo posted by FEMALE COLLECTIVE (@femalecollective) on Jan 12, 2017 at 2:58pm PST 
20% of the proceeds Female Collective receives for their â€œGirls Just Wanna Have Fun-ding For Planned Parenthoodâ€ shirts will be donated to Planned Parenthood. Female Collective also partnered with Bustle on their â€œYou Do You(terus)â€ tee . 50% of after-profit funds from that design is headed over to Global Fund for Women. You can do a lot of good shopping Female Collective!
3. Otherwild â€” â€œThe Future Is Femaleâ€ merch ($30-$60) Youâ€™ve seriously been living under a rock if you havenâ€™t heard â€œThe Future Is Femaleâ€ declared from the mouth of a proud feminist. According to Otherwildâ€™s website, the slogan was first created for t-shirts sold in Labyris Books, New Yorkâ€™s first womenâ€™s bookstore, which opened in 1972.
Seeing double #thefutureisfemale as captured by @christel.robleto â£ï¸ 
A photo posted by OTHERWILD (@otherwild) on Nov 28, 2016 at 7:25am PST 
Otherwild revamped the slogan and slapped it on tees, crewnecks, tanks, and even kidsâ€™ clothes. When you buy a piece of â€œThe Future Is Femaleâ€ clothing, 25% of those proceeds will go to Planned Parenthood. Otherwild also sells clothing from which proceeds will go to The National Center for Transgender Equality and the Lesbian Herstory Archives.
4. The Outrage â€” â€œNasty Women Uniteâ€ collection ($3-$125) â€œCalling all nasty women!â€ The Outrage writes on their website. â€œThe Donald thinks intelligent, empowered, and articulate women are nasty. We say he ainâ€™t seen nothinâ€™ yet.â€ Hell to the freaky-freak yes!
hearts are full. #strongertogether #theoutrage #womensmarchonwashington @nathanhaddix 
A photo posted by the-outrage (@theoutrageonline) on Jan 23, 2017 at 11:13am PST 
When you shop The Outrageâ€™s â€œNasty Women Uniteâ€ collection, 15% of the collectionâ€™s proceeds are going to Planned Parenthood â€” â€œin Donaldâ€™s name.â€ These guys donâ€™t just sell clothing, either. Enamel pins, embroidery hoops, mugs, tote bags, postcards â€” the list goes on. Plus, with items starting at just $3, anyone with any budget can help Planned Parenthood even if itâ€™s just by a couple cents.
The Outrage also has a â€œWomenâ€™s March on Washingtonâ€ collection, and will be donating 100% of the money earned from the collection to subsidize travel costs for march participants with limited financial means. The company has a few other collections that support some amazing causes, so the bottom line is that you have to check The Outrage out.
5. Google Ghost â€” â€œNasty Womanâ€ t-shirt ($25) Canâ€™t get enough â€œNasty Womanâ€ in your life? Then add the â€œNasty Womanâ€ tee from Google Ghost to your growing collection. 50% of funds collected from these tees is going straight to Planned Parenthood. According to Google Ghost, $110,165 has been donated thus far. Thatâ€™s pretty darn cool.
: @dressupwithjess 
A photo posted by Google Ghost (@googleghostpress) on Jan 22, 2017 at 10:31am PST 
Youâ€™ll want to be a part of this girl gang after scrolling through Google Ghostâ€™s Instagram feed for less than five minutes. These Nasty Women are doing great things while spreading feminism near and far. You can also opt to donate to PP via a crewneck sweatshirt or coffee mug if youâ€™re feeling chilly from the straight ice weâ€™re receiving from the White House rn. Up to you!

6. MostlySweetJewelry â€” â€œNastyâ€ female symbol pendant ($50) Whatâ€™s that? You need more nasty? Ok! You asked for it! MostlySweetJewelry has created this badass female symbol silver pendant with â€œNastyâ€ hammered into it so no one can tell you that you are not nasty. â€œAll will be made with strength, care, love, and sometimes wearing a pantsuit,â€ LothLorien Stewart, the Etsy shop owner, wrote in the description.
Etsy / MostlySweetJewelry Stewart pledged that for every pendant sold, she would donate $10 to Planned Parenthood â€œon behalf of Hilary Clinton, All Women, and all the wonderful people in Pantsuit Nation,â€ she wrote. Four weeks ago, Stewart updated her Etsy page to inform patrons that 97 of these beauties had been sold. She doubled that number and donated $1940 to PP in Mike Penceâ€™s name. Weâ€™re crying with joy.
7. TheTumbleeedShop â€” Handmade knitted Pussy Hats ($20) Danielle Christensen, owner of TheTumbleweedShop on Etsy, is in the process of making Pussy Hats for those who didnâ€™t get theirs at the Womenâ€™s March on Saturday. She only has three available right now, but sheâ€™s still chugging right along. Half of her Pussy Hat proceeds will be donated to PP.
Etsy / TheTumbleweedShop As of yesterday, Christensen informed Etsy patrons that she will be making her first Planned Parenthood donation this weekend after selling her first eight handmade hats. With hopefully many more Womenâ€™s Marches in the future, you wonâ€™t want to miss the opportunity to grab a Pussy Hat that was made for a good cause.
8. Marc Jacobs â€” â€œPro-Choice Mileyâ€ and â€œMiley Hearts Planned Parenthoodâ€ t-shirts ($50) This one goes out to all the fashionistas who love a good designer piece. These two collaborative tees are the product of three creative minds coming together for a good cause. The tees display two original prints by artist Marilyn Minter, who worked with Miley Cyrus to come up with the concept.
Marc Jacobs Both shirts are being sold exclusively in Marc Jacobs boutiques and online stores. 100% of the profit made from the tees is being donated to Planned Parenthood. You can head over to the Marc Jacobs website to see how the shots of Miley were taken and also how the shirts were individually printed.
9. LaurelAndLime â€” â€œHear Me Roarâ€ bracelets ($25) These beautiful handmade copper cuffs, based on Katy Perryâ€™s famous lyric from her song â€œRoar,â€ is perfect for the feminist who appreciates a good piece of handcrafted jewelry. Katie Kelly, owner of the LaurelAndLime Etsy shop, makes each cuff from reclaimed copper. They are one-size-fits all, and can be easily adjusted.
Esty / LaurelAndLime For every bracelet sold, Kelly is donating $5 to Planned Parenthood. Plus, because Kelly uses reclaimed, natural, and recycled materials, buying a piece of her jewelry is an eco-conscious decision. Donating to PP and saving the Earth while getting an amazing bracelet at the end of the day? This deal is too good to pass up!
10. rubygirl â€” â€œFeministâ€ fundraiser necklace ($30) â€œFeministâ€ is a label we should be proud to wear on our chests at this point in time. This necklace from rubygirl on Etsy can help you do just that. Creator of the â€œFeministâ€ necklace, Shannon, wrote in the description for this piece, â€œI am done feeling helpless and hopeless and so I decided to DO something. I made this sweet little necklace to announce to the world who I am and now you can, too!â€
Etsy / rubygirl Shannon is donating $10 from every sale to PP. On December 30th, she was able to donate a total of $620! Thatâ€™s a lot of money! Shipping for Shannonâ€™s necklace is free to those who live in the United States, and each one is made by hand with sterling silver and love. You canâ€™t beat that duo.
11. Tictail â€” â€œStay Togetherâ€ Planned Parenthood print ($75) Artist, Shawna X, is selling a print called â€œStay Togetherâ€ through the site Tictail. She writes, â€œI want to donate all profits of this print to Planned Parenthood, an organization that has helped me with my birth control, check-ups and various concerns regarding my reproduction and sexual health since I could remember and when I had very little resource. Thank you PP for all you have done for women across the country.â€ Amen, amen, amen!
Tictail As mentioned above, Shawna X is donating all profits made from this print to PP. With each print going for $75, that can be a huge sum of money. Itâ€™s a pretty groovy piece of art that has a great cause and story behind it. It just might be worth the investment!
12. amandaatkins â€” â€œWomenâ€™s Rights are Human Rightsâ€ print ($14) Straight from the face of a Womenâ€™s March poster, this â€œWomenâ€™s Rights are Human Rightsâ€ print by artist, Amanda Atkins, boasts one of the many anthems feminists weâ€™re chanting. Now, you can have your own smaller version to keep the fire going until the next march.
Etsy / amandaatkins Buying one of these prints secures a $5 donation to Planned Parenthood. For only $14, youâ€™re getting an 8.5â€³ x 11â€³ print â€“ which is an amazing deal for quality art. This is a perfect start or welcome addition to a possible feminist themed art wall in your home, or to give to a friend who is a firm advocate for womenâ€™s rights!
The time has come to fight, fight, fight! We cannot and will not stand down, ladies. Bulk up on feminist merchandise and wear it all to the next march. Weâ€™re defending our rights, our bodies, and each other. We would tell you to stay strong, but we already know that youâ€™re strong AF!
